sentences.english: Insomnia is both a symptom and a cause of depression and anxiety.
sentences.chinese: 失眠既是一種症狀又是導致沮喪和緊張的肇因。

sentences.english: The driver's carelessness may have contributed to the accident.
sentences.chinese: 司機的疏失可能是這起意外的肇因。

sentences.english: Climate change is a contributing factor, but not the only one.
sentences.chinese: 氣候變化是一個肇因，但並非是唯一的肇因。

sentences.english: Climate change is a contributing factor, but not the only one.
sentences.chinese: 氣候變化是一個肇因，但並非是唯一的肇因。

sentences.english: Cause of suffering: We are the cause of our suffering.
sentences.chinese: 我們是自己痛苦的肇因。

sentences.english: Later, all the people pumping out steel on the causes of this.
sentences.chinese: 後來的全民大鍊鋼鐵就肇因於此。

sentences.english: The main causes of this are bureaucracy and isometric struggles against competition.
sentences.chinese: 主要的肇因是官僚系統和各種角力對競爭的阻礙。

sentences.english: You cannot be saved from the world, but you can escape from its cause.
sentences.chinese: 你無法超脫這個世界，可是你卻能逃離它的肇因。

definition: to get into disarray/to get out of whack
to reverse cause and effect/to put the horse before the cart
bizarre/paradoxical/a paradox (from Daoist classic Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子)
to depend ultimately on (Tw)/absolutely reliant on
variant of 意識形態|意识形态[yi4 shi2 xing2 tai4]
